CatDescriptText: Mr. Jesse Jones, 3345 Milwaukee Street and Mr. Joseph Nathan, 2015 Wendover Street, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 12, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "Should well defined courses in sex education be taught in public school system? If so, at what grade should the teaching of these courses begin?" Mr. Jesses Jones' answer reads: "It's hard to say at which age the child should be taught.  I think that ten years of age, at the lowest, should be the time when the child begins receiving a well-rounded sex education.  After ten years of age you can't put too much emphasis on the teaching.  I have a girl about that age and I think that is the proper time to enlighten kids.  My boy is 11 years old and at that age youngsters can't receive too much education of this type.  It certainly should be taught at school, because that is the only intelligent way to do it."  Mr. Joseph Nathan's answer reads: "I believe in it because it seems only natural.  And I think that it should begin around the age of 16."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Jesse Jones, and Joseph Nathan, holding cigar, standing in front of stone wall with pedestrians and street on right
